text:
In order keep the information secure stored in the session scope object,
a cookie tranferred via SSL should have "Secure" option in many cases.
Otherwise, if malicious peole can guilde the web user to the non-SSL URL,
he/she can intercept JSESSIONID contained in the HTTP request header.

Because the cookie for JSESSIONID cannot be modified from the web applications,
this should be done by modification of the Tomcat itself.


Reference (in Japanese):
http://www.ipa.go.jp/security/ciadr/20030808cookie-secure.html
